alert.note: Alert for Lake Mead NRA, Colorado River-AZ side (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LasVegas (Southern Nevada, Southeastern California, Northwestern Arizona)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued April 18 at 12:42AM MST until April 19 at 9:00PM MST by NWS LasVegas
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 9 AM TO 9 PM TUESDAY FOR STRONG WINDS AND LOW HUMIDITY FOR FAR SOUTHERN NEVADA... The National Weather Service in Las Vegas has issued a Red Flag Warning, which is in effect from Tuesday morning through Tuesday evening. The Fire Weather Watch is no longer in effect. * AFFECTED AREA...In Arizona...Fire weather zone 101. In Nevada...Fire weather zones 462, 463, 464, 465, and 466. * TIMING...9 AM PDT/MST until 9 PM PDT/MST. * WIND...Southwest 20 to 30 mph with gusts 40 to 50 mph. Localized gusts 55 to 65 mph possible in the Spring Mountains and Red Rock Canyon. * HUMIDITY...Minimum values 5 to 12 percent. * IMPACTS...any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now...or will shortly. A combination of strong winds...low relative humidity...and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.

area.areaDesc: Lake Mead NRA, Colorado River-AZ side
